alert.note: Alert for Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 5:48PM EST until February 18 at 8:49AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers... Raccoon Creek near Granville. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Raccoon Creek near Granville. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, Portions of Route 539A are flooded with water breaching the bike path on the west side of Granville. Water will approach Granville Square Apartments between the bike path and West Broadway, as well as the waste water treatment plant and the operational building of the Granville Water Plant. This crest compares to the flood of January 2005. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 15.3 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
